Counsel to the husband: to the wife instruction A short and pithy treatise of seuerall and ioynt duties, belonging vnto man and wife, as counsels to the one, and instructions to the other; for their more perfect happinesse in this present life, and their eternall glorie in the life to come. Ste. B.
[6], 97, [1] p.
Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Richard Boyle, At London : 1608.
Dedication signed: Ste. B. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

[6], 97, [1] p.
Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Richard Boyle, At London : 1608.
